dialogues.text: All I can say is that when these radicals act outside the law, recklessly endangering the environment and human lives, it clearly demonstrates that they are the menace and we are the victims.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The TELEVISION is ON, though "MUTED."  We hear O'BRIEN GRUNTING and the sound of sweaty RUBBER RUBBING AGAINST RUBBER. The door opens and Susan enters, a pizza box in one hand, briefcase in the other.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: Daniel? As she enters, she notices something is different about the furniture. There is a second, flesh-colored love seat. O'Brien's head suddenly pops up.

dialogues.speaker: O'BRIEN
dialogues.text: Surprise! His head rises from the top of the back.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: That's pretty good.

dialogues.speaker: O'BRIEN
dialogues.text: Getting used to it. He starts to get up, becoming human, the round padded sea swelling into buttocks when he realizes he is naked.

dialogues.speaker: O'BRIEN
dialogues.text: Whoa! He pops back to a chair.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: Don't worry, I got just what you need. A leg of the chair shoots out as he grabs his underwear from the pile of clothes. Susan sets the pizza down and opens her briefcase.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: I have a friend at a textile lab. She helped me. The O'Brien chair pulls the underwear up over the front two legs, covering the cushion as he stands changing back to normal.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: Ta-da! She holds up a tiny red suit that looks big enough for a G.I. Joe doll.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that?

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: It's a crime fighting costume, what do you think? It's underwear, so if you lose your clothes you'll still be decent.

dialogues.speaker: O'BRIEN
dialogues.text: That's going to fit me?

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: Like a glove. He pulls at it. It stretches easily.

dialogues.speaker: O'BRIEN
dialogues.text: You made this out of my hair?

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: Sort of. We used a process similar to the vulcanization of rubber and added bulk with a chain of chloroprene elastomers. He shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: O'BRIEN
dialogues.text: I bet you still kill at Scrabble. She smiles.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: Go on, try it on. Oh wait... She reaches back into her bag.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: There was some extra, so I made these. In her palm are two little red boots.

dialogues.speaker: O'BRIEN
dialogues.text: Cute. As he crosses to the bathroom we see the television is again updating the crisis at Argon Labs.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: Did you go?

dialogues.speaker: O'BRIEN
dialogues.text: On the counter. She grabs the sample, heading immediately for the  basement, when the television catches her eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Brien crams one foot in and then the other. The material stretches miraculously.

dialogues.speaker: O'BRIEN
dialogues.text: Groovy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Brien bounds out of the bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: O'BRIEN
dialogues.text: ‘In brightest day, nor darkest night. No evil shall escape my sight." Susan is silent in front of the TV, the sound now ON. She is still holding the beaker.

dialogues.speaker: O'BRIEN
dialogues.text: What is it? He moves around her and sees his own face on the screen. It is the black and white photo of him about to sneeze. At the bottom of the screen is the title, "Voice of Dr. Warren Wertham."

dialogues.speaker: DR. WERTHAM, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: -+. an extremely volatile individual given to emotional outbursts.

dialogues.speaker: O'BRIEN
dialogues.text: Wertham? That's no good.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: Who is he?

dialogues.speaker: O'BRIEN
dialogues.text: The head shrinker at the prison.

dialogues.speaker: DR. WERTHAM, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: ... paranoid delusions and prone to hero fantasies all of which are characteristic of a form of infantile dementia.

dialogues.speaker: O'BRIEN
dialogues.text: Ha! What a crock. He couldn't be more wrong, could he? She says nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said, could he? The sneeze picture shrinks to an insert over the anchor woman, Tawney Towers' shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: TAWNEY, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Once again, at this time, authorities continue their statewide manhunt for the man believed responsible for the situation developing at Argon Labs. As reports come in, News Center 5 will continue to update you. Susan cuts it OFF.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: Oh no. They're trying to blame you for the accident. That means they must not have been able to control the replicators.

dialogues.speaker: O'BRIEN
dialogues.text: I can't go back to jail. I gotta get out of here.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: You're not going back to jail. All we need to do is find the nanobot. Once the meltdown is under control, then we deal with Argon -- Suddenly, the front door explodes open, the jamb easily splintering under Doby's girth. Doby and Sim barrel in, pistols pointing.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: What in the hell?

dialogues.speaker: SIM
dialogues.text: Pipe down, brain lady! And you... The gun sweeps toward O'Brien.

dialogues.speaker: SIM
dialogues.text: I'd curb that monkey business, lessin' you want to find out if that rubber skin of yours is bulletproof. Now, keep your hands where I can see them. He notices the urine sample.

dialogues.speaker: SIM
dialogues.text: What's that?  Susan doesn't miss a beat.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: Lemonade. Do you want some? She offers him the beaker. Sim considers it.

dialogues.speaker: SIM
dialogues.text: No thanks. Back to business.

dialogues.speaker: SIM
dialogues.text: Put it down and let's go. Someone wants to talk to you. He waves them out the front door as she sets the beaker o the counter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The black LIMO FIRES UP as the foursome approach. Sim opens the back door for O'Brien and Dr. Bright.

dialogues.speaker: SIM
dialogues.text: Get in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the artificial coolness, Daniel O'Brien sits with Icarus Argon, across from Poppy, Susan, and Dr. Nebbleman In the rear window we see Sim's Lincoln follow. Poppy brandishes a chrome revolver from her handbag. Argon smiles in the shady light, makeup covering the more abrasive features of his spotty skin.

dialogues.speaker: ARGON
dialogues.text: My apologies to you both for the rather rude invitation but I had to see you. And, Dr. Bright, your house isn't... He motions to his blanket-draped legs.

dialogues.speaker: ARGON
dialogues.text: Wheelchair accessible.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: Dr. Argon, I demand an explanation.

dialogues.speaker: O'BRIEN
dialogues.text: I can explain it. Attempted murder wasn't enough for him. He wants to add kidnapping to the charges.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you'd like, we can go straight to the authorities. I understand they are very interested in talking to you. O'Brien's only response is to grind his teeth in silence.

dialogues.speaker: ARGON
dialogues.text: We haven't been properly introduced, Mr. O'Brien. I am Icarus Argon. He offers his hand, taking O'Brien's. He closes his eyes, beginning to caress O'Brien's hand between the withered brown flesh of his own.

dialogues.speaker: ARGON
dialogues.text: Do you know how I made my first fortune? Poly vinyl chloride. P.V.C. It was almost thirty years ago when I first held a credit card in my hands. There was something about the way it felt. I told myself, paper was doomed. This was the future... He looks at O'Brien's hand, lets go.

dialogues.speaker: ARGON
dialogues.text: -.. plastic.

dialogues.speaker: O'BRIEN
dialogues.text: Wow, that is one moving story. Take it easy on my heart strings. Now I really feel guilty complaining about you shooting me up with your poison.

dialogues.speaker: ARGON
dialogues.text: Poison? I'm surprised at you. You lack vision, Mr. O'Brien.

dialogues.speaker: O'BRIEN
dialogues.text: You're lacking a few things too: ethics, morals, common decency and, oh yeah, deodorant. Argon smiles. His coolness irritates O'Brien.

dialogues.speaker: ARGON
dialogues.text: Look at me, Mr. O'Brien. I once competed for Mr. Universe but now I am reduced to this, a withered shell. A prison of rot. He leans into O'Brien.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People ask me what I did to myself. I answer, what didn't I do?! I treat me body like I treat the rest of the world, as a force to be controlled. Most people believe there is something sacred about the human body, about nature. They are the same fools who thought the world was flat. O'Brien smirks.

dialogues.speaker: ARGON
dialogues.text: The body is just another part of nature and ever since we gave up trees for central air, there has been nothing sacred about nature. Nature is the enemy, Mr. O'Brien, and science is our greatest weapon against her.

dialogues.speaker: O'BRIEN
dialogues.text: You egomaniacs make me laugh. Nature's going to bury you like she buries everyone else. Argon laughs.

dialogues.speaker: ARGON
dialogues.text: Not anymore, Mr. O'Brien. The nanobot has changed that.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: If you think I would ever give you the nanobot after this, you are deluding yourself.

dialogues.speaker: ARGON
dialogues.text: You don't have to give it to us because Dr. Nebbleman can just cut it out of him.

dialogues.speaker: O'BRIEN
dialogues.text: Ha! Morons. It's not even in me anymore. Everyone reacts.

dialogues.speaker: ARGON
dialogues.text: What? Before O'Brien can say anything else, Susan slaps her han over his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: NEBBLEMAN
dialogues.text: She could have given him something to stimulate his kidneys.

dialogues.speaker: ARGON
dialogues.text: Dr. Nebbleman, take care of them. Argon grabs the car phone while Nebbleman removes a loade syringe from a black case.

dialogues.speaker: ARGON
dialogues.text: Mr. Sim I want you to return to Dr. Bright's. I believe she is hiding something of ours there.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: No. We see the Lincoln turn off the highway.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: Daniel, do something! With eye blurring speed, O'Brien's arm rockets out as he grabs for the needle. Nebbleman screams as O'Brien's hand molds over his own. Poppy wheels on O'Brien as Nebbleman falls, screaming, wrestling against his own hand. Before she can raise the gun, Dr. Bright lunges, grapplin for control. The GUN FIRES wildly.

dialogues.speaker: ARGON
dialogues.text: No! The BULLET RICOCHETS around the cabin before embedding in the seat cushion in between Nebbleman's legs. O'Brien pushes the hypo plunger down, squirting the sedative in Nebbleman's face. Nebbleman screams.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: Daniel, go! I'll be all right! Get the nanobot! He nods, yanking the door handles but they are locked. He glances quickly around the limo, then dives at the rea seat, body thinning, flattening into the crack where the seat meets the back -- Leaving Poppy clinging to his empty clothes, as he disappears from the cabin. Nebbleman can hardly catch his breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where did he go?

dialogues.speaker: ARGON
dialogues.text: The trunk. As soon as the words pass Argon's reptilian lips, there i a CLICK and the TRUNK opens behind them.

dialogues.speaker: ARGON
dialogues.text: ott, shake him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Brien stands and the limo begins to zig-zag hard on the open expressway. Argon smiles through the small rear window as O'Brien tries to keep his balance.

dialogues.speaker: O'BRIEN
dialogues.text: Here goes nothing. O'Brien throws an arm at a passing truck going in the opposite direction seizing hold of it -- Slinging himself like a rubber band -- Into the air, tucking his knees to his chest, bracing himself. He becomes -- A red comet, that crashes into an oncoming Cadillac cavin in its hood and rebounding into the air soaring over a ro of homes. A rumpled heap, he lands heavily in a plot of backyard bushes.

dialogues.speaker: O'BRIEN
dialogues.text: Ow. He stumbles to his feet, shaking away the cobwebs.

dialogues.speaker: O'BRIEN
dialogues.text: Damn. His teeth grit. Muscles flex.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ROCKETS INTO the air -- SHOOTING STRAIGHT UP, RACING FORWARD BOUNDING OVER power lines and rooftops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Order has been somewhat restored. Poppy presses the barrel of her pistol into Dr. Bright's midsection. Dr. Nebbleman is still red-faced from the physical exertion. His glasses begin to fog and he cleans them with his kerchief. The PHONES RINGS.

dialogues.speaker: NEBBLEMAN
dialogues.text: Yes?

dialogues.speaker: SIM, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: It's Sim. We're almost there.

dialogues.speaker: NEBBLEMAN
dialogues.text: Mr. Sim, watch out! O'Brien escaped and could be on his way!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two small children are playing in their sandbox. Suddenly, a red foot stomps down between them, the thin leg stretching up into the sky. It rocks forward and pushes off and away. The two kids stare at each other blankly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sim and Doby head for the front door, Sim still on his cellular phone.

dialogues.speaker: SIM
dialogues.text: You want to tell me what I'm looking for?

dialogues.speaker: NEBBLEMAN
dialogues.text: I've only been invited to her house once, but I know there is a basement lab that she uses for private research.

dialogues.speaker: SIM, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: You were never invited to my house.

dialogues.speaker: NEBBLEMAN
dialogues.text: You're looking for a urine sample.

dialogues.speaker: SIM, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Bingo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sim stares toward the basement, when out of the corner of his eye he notices --

dialogues.speaker: NEBBLEMAN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: The fluid should be murky yellow in color and extremely viscous. The beaker of lemonade.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Brien grabs the top of a building and he vaults over as though hopping a fence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sim inspects the beaker as if he might taste it. He takes a whiff.

dialogues.speaker: SIM
dialogues.text: Wait a minute. This ain't no lemonade.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Susan glares at Nebbleman.

dialogues.speaker: SIM, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: What's it smell like?

dialogues.speaker: NEBBLEMAN
dialogues.text: smell? Uh, something like methylcyanoacrylate.

dialogues.speaker: SIM, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Like Crazy Glue?

dialogues.speaker: NEBBLEMAN
dialogues.text: Yes. That's it. He's got it. Oh God, he's got it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Brien watches from behind a light post as Sim and Doby cross from Susan's walk to the Lincoln. He slinks down among the row of parked cars and edges out toward the street. The black Lincoln starts TOWARD us getting bigger, FILLIN OUR VISION, then PASSES OVER -- And we see O'Brien clinging to the chassis like a rubbery  Max Cady.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The afternoon sun has started its descend over the industrial landscape. Tongues of exhaust flame lick up at the orange popsicle sky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The black limousine eases through the gate against the swell of media. The steel garage DOOR RATTLES down like a modern portcullis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The barrel-shaped limo driver helps Argon into his wheelchair.

dialogues.speaker: POPPY
dialogues.text: Gently, Ott. Gently.

dialogues.speaker: ARGON
dialogues.text: Dr. Nebbleman, I want to know the moment the nanobot arrives. The instant, understand?

dialogues.speaker: NEBBLEMAN
dialogues.text: Of course, sir.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: Dr. Argon, I know you want to use the nanobot on yourself, but you mustn't. The situation is critical right now. The replicators are growing exponentially. If we wait much longer it will be too late. You have to use the nanobot to stop the meltdown.

dialogues.speaker: ARGON
dialogues.text: Dr. Bright, I don't have to do anything.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: But in another twenty-four hours the core meltdown will be beyond the stabilization period. There will be no way to stop it.

dialogues.speaker: ARGON
dialogues.text: To be brutally honest with you, Susan, as long as the nanobot does to me what it did to that idiot O'Brien, I don't give a rat's ass  about what happens after that. The sincerity of his smile unnerves her.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: You can't mean that.

dialogues.speaker: ARGON
dialogues.text: Come with me, Susan. I want to show you something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The elevators open and Poppy, Argon and Susan get out.

dialogues.speaker: ARGON
dialogues.text: Something to drink, Dr. Bright?

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: No, thank you.

dialogues.speaker: ARGON
dialogues.text: You'll forgive me but all the excitement has left me extremely parched. Poppy? Poppy gets him a Coca-Cola while Susan notices the statue of Argon.

dialogues.speaker: ARGON
dialogues.text: A monument to my past. I much prefer the future. Come.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The moist air envelops them as they enter.

dialogues.speaker: ARGON
dialogues.text: This is my garden. Few people have seen it because it means so much to me. I am hoping as a fellow scientist you can appreciate it. It is a botanical nightmare. Huge sealed tanks feature bizarre plant-life bred and genetically engineered indiscriminately, like a blind man pairing a sock drawer. Susan moves onto the yellow brick lane, a look of horror wrinkling her face.

dialogues.speaker: ARGON
dialogues.text: Gardener? A man in a green jump suit looks up. This is the GARDENER. He is never without his red sprayer tank, slung over his shoulder and is always wearing an old snouted ga mask.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you excuse us? He disappears as the three start down the path.

dialogues.speaker: ARGON
dialogues.text: Every species, every organism is the only one of its kind, created through cross-breeding or chemical and radioactive mutation as well as genetic manipulation. Inside atmospherically controlled tanks, life exists wher it should not. Translucent palmy ferns bask beneath a deadly drizzle of acid rain. Crystalline cacti flourish around the soft glow of a radioactive isotope.

dialogues.speaker: ARGON
dialogues.text: I spend more time here than anywhere else, nurturing them, treating them, because they all require very special care. He gazes into a sealed geranium at a single flower with petals the color of a dead fish. It is being fed drops of photophorescent paste from tubes that hang like IVs.

dialogues.speaker: ARGON
dialogues.text: Poppy calls them my children and I suppose that's how I feel. That I have given birth to all of them, and there is nothing as precious or as beautiful as one's own children. Poppy smiles at him as they stop in front of a tank where seamonkey-like creatures titter and play inside their toxic solarium.

dialogues.speaker: ARGON
dialogues.text: We will always love most that which we create. Don't you agree, Susan?

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: Does that mean Oppenheimer loved the atomic bomb? She can't believe that she just used an O'Brien line.

dialogues.speaker: ARGON
dialogues.text: More than he would ever admit. His child changed the world. What could make a parent more proud than that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The black Lincoln glides into the garage.  The door closes behind them and the car eases into the parking place, the cement block in front of the car reads D.T. Sim; Chief of Security. FROM UNDER the car we see the feet of Sim and Doby sweep by then disappear as the two men enter the lobby of Argon Tower. O'Brien drops to the ground from the Lincoln's drive shaf letting out a string of whispered expletives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Argon slurps from the Coca-Cola, watching Susan.

dialogues.speaker: ARGON
dialogues.text: I brought you up here, Dr. Bright, because I want you to understand that we are on the path. The only difference is that you are walking with your head down, afraid to look up, to see where the path is going.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: I suppose you are going to tell me where it is going.

dialogues.speaker: ARGON
dialogues.text: I ask you what is the purpose of science? What is the point of all our relentless exploration, investigation and experimentation? It is to understand a single physical phenomenon, or to understand them all? To cure one disease, or to cure every disease? If science is simply a means, what then is the end? His WHEELCHAIR CLICKS and HUMS toward her.

dialogues.speaker: ARGON
dialogues.text: Look up. Look above you, Susan, and tell me what you see. She looks up through the glass roof of the conservatory a the soot-stained sky.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: Pollution?

dialogues.speaker: ARGON
dialogues.text: Do you know what I see? I see man making his own clouds. I see man coloring his own sky, and like this garden it is a site that makes my  heart sing. He licks his lips.

dialogues.speaker: ARGON
dialogues.text: This is our world, Susan, and once you realize that, you will understand that the only place our path can end is on the throne of heaven. Science is the quest for divine perfection.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: How do you know we're not heading in the wrong direction?

dialogues.speaker: ARGON
dialogues.text: I look behind us, I look to the past, to a world steeped in rot and decay. I think of the Acropolis in another century reduced to little more than dust. I see the faces of Rushmore eventually losing all distinction, and then I look at this... He cradles the plastic bottle of Coca-Cola.

dialogues.speaker: ARGON
dialogues.text: And I imagine it in a thousand years as perfectly shaped as the day it was made. He smiles at her.

dialogues.speaker: ARGON
dialogues.text: I find that thought exceptionally reassuring. Nebbleman burst through the glass doors.

dialogues.speaker: NEBBLEMAN
dialogues.text: They're here! They're here! We have the nanobot.

dialogues.speaker: ARGON
dialogues.text: Excellent. How long until the assembler tank is complete? Nebbleman's glasses steam up from the humidity as he stumbles toward them.

dialogues.speaker: NEBBLEMAN
dialogues.text: Dr. Makeo is working on it now, sir. I estimate at least another six hours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the meantime, why don't you find something useful for Dr. Bright to do.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: I swear to you, Argon, if you don't stop the meltdown that nanobot will be the last one I ever build.

dialogues.speaker: ARGON
dialogues.text: Susan, I sense you are having difficulty understanding the situation you are presently in. I ask that you keep in mind that I am ready to reduce an entire city to gelatin to get what I want. Susan notices the guards posted at the door.

dialogues.speaker: ARGON
dialogues.text: If I were you, I'd be careful about making promises that you will be unable to keep. His smile is as subtle as a knife point.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Brien sneaks ever so silently, edging toward the door a the opposite end. The walls are covered with an impressive collection by artists like Dali, Picasso and Bacon, picture-lit dramatically. As he nears the end, he suddenly hears voices moving toward him. He jumps back, searching for a place to hide. Two armed GUARDS enter.

dialogues.speaker: GUARD
dialogues.text: Who are we supposed to be looking for?

dialogues.speaker: GUARD
dialogues.text: Some guy in red underwear. They do not notice the bizarre red portrait hanging on th wall.

dialogues.speaker: GUARD
dialogues.text: How are we supposed to know the color of his underwear?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A guard is posted outside Susan's room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scientific equipment is piled in a room that looks like a guest bedroom. Awkwardly filling the center of the room is a long industrial freezer unit. Nebbleman and Susan are alone.

dialogues.speaker: NEBBLEMAN
dialogues.text: These samples were taken from the surrounding area. All the pertinent information is on disk. Nebbleman lifts the lid, cold air puffing out, spilling over the freezer's edge.

dialogues.speaker: NEBBLEMAN
dialogues.text: What we need to know is expansion rates, how soon the replicators will reach the edge of the compound. Inside there are several normal-looking objects taken fro the lab, including a metal stool, a microscope and severa glass beakers. She stares at him numbly.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: I don't believe this is happening...

dialogues.speaker: NEBBLEMAN
dialogues.text: Susan, Dr. Argon is giving you an opportunity here.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: Opportunity? That snaps her up.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: There's a guard outside my door! I'm a prisoner, Nigel! Do you understand that?

dialogues.speaker: NEBBLEMAN
dialogues.text: Dr. Argon would say we are all prisoners.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: Argon is a lunatic! I can't believe I was stupid enough to believe I could control him. You heard what he said, Nigel. He doesn't care if  all of Calumet City is turned to Jell-O. How can that not affect you? Because I am a new man, aman of vision. Your

dialogues.speaker: NEBBLEMAN
dialogues.text: Susan. I am problem, Susan, is that you're always looking down. I£ you'd just look up you'd see the big picture and in the big picture men of vision do not dwell on what might be lost. on what can be gained. They focus

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: Is that what Argon told you?

dialogues.speaker: NEBBLEMAN
dialogues.text: No! Well, not those exact words.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: Nigel, can't you see he's using you?

dialogues.speaker: NEBBLEMAN
dialogues.text: Of course he is, but at least there isn't a security guard outside my door. You're afraid of him. Who isn't? Her eyes narrow. Daniel O'Brien.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Brien tip-toes past an intersecting hears -- Hey... O'Brien freezes. Hey, you!

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: hall when he

dialogues.speaker: SECURITY
dialogues.text: The security man is a hundred feet away, but before he ca

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: even get his gun out - O'Brien's arm shoots down the hall, a reaching -- huge hand Covering the security man's entire head before he is abl to scream. The hand is like a plastic bag over his head that he can' get free of until he finally blacks out. O'Brien lays him down gently. His arm snaps back and he tip-toes away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nebbleman smirks, cleaning his glasses.

dialogues.speaker: NEBBLEMAN
dialogues.text: I'm not interested in being a hero, Susan. I'm not interested in self- delusion and romantic sentiment. He puts his glasses back on.

dialogues.speaker: NEBBLEMAN
dialogues.text: I'ma scientist. I have lived my whole life by the diagnostic application of fact and the fact is, Argon is going to get whatever he wants, so if I were you, I'd give it to him.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: You mean the designs for the nanobot? You think after this I'm going to give them to him?

dialogues.speaker: NEBBLEMAN
dialogues.text: I think that either you're going to give them to him or he's going to make you give them to him.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: Make me? How? You think he's going to torture me? Nebbleman shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: NEBBLEMAN
dialogues.text: I would. He smiles and that makes it worse.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: Get out. Get out now before I hurt you. Nebbleman stammers before scurrying for the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Brien is searching different rooms, stuffing his head between door and jamb, calling, "Susan," in a hushed voice. The elevator at the end of the hall opens and he hears th ELECTRIC WHINE of Argon's WHEELCHAIR together with the TA of Poppy's STILETTO HEELS. He presses himself flat against the nearest door.

dialogues.speaker: POPPY
dialogues.text: Do you think she will give us the designs?

dialogues.speaker: ARGON
dialogues.text: Eventually. These things are always a matter of leverage.

dialogues.speaker: POPPY
dialogues.text: And you think O'Brien is that leverage?

dialogues.speaker: ARGON
dialogues.text: That remains to be seen. O'Brien peeks out and sees that they are heading straight at him.

dialogues.speaker: POPPY
dialogues.text: And you still believe he's going to come here?

dialogues.speaker: ARGON
dialogues.text: Based on what we know of him, that would seem inevitable.

dialogues.speaker: POPPY
dialogues.text: Do you think she loves him?

dialogues.speaker: ARGON
dialogues.text: She must feel something for him. After all, she and I did create him. It seems they are about to see him but when they reach th double doors, O'Brien is gone. She throws open the door and he follows her into --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything is red; PVC gleaming like patent leather.

dialogues.speaker: POPPY
dialogues.text: Do you think she loves him like I love you?  It is a woman's question and it annoys him.

dialogues.speaker: ARGON
dialogues.text: Poppy, are you in one of your moods again?

dialogues.speaker: POPPY
dialogues.text: No, Icky, this is real. She closes the doors behind them.

dialogues.speaker: POPPY
dialogues.text: I've been thinking a lot since this all started. Thinking about us. Uninterested in the direction of the conversation, Argon notices that there are two identical ottomans.

dialogues.speaker: POPPY
dialogues.text: You know how I feel about you. You know how much I need you. How much I trust you. I would do anything for you.

dialogues.speaker: ARGON
dialogues.text: Why are there two ottomans?

dialogues.speaker: POPPY
dialogues.text: Icarus, please! This is important! She sees him staring at the ottoman and steps up onto it, heels gouging into the padding. The OTTOMAN GURGLES.

dialogues.speaker: POPPY
dialogues.text: Look at me, Icarus! Look at my body. I've done everything, changed anything you asked me to. ‘'We will always love most that which we create.' Is that still true?

dialogues.speaker: ARGON
dialogues.text: Yes. Yes, of course it is.

dialogues.speaker: POPPY
dialogues.text: Then you still love me?

dialogues.speaker: ARGON
dialogues.text: Poppy, please, just tell me what you want. She steps down and kneels close to the wheelchair.

dialogues.speaker: POPPY
dialogues.text: I want to know what will happen if the nanobot works on you become like  O'Brien, a plastic man. What will happen to me? He realizes what she is asking.

dialogues.speaker: ARGON
dialogues.text: You want to be polymerized? Timidly, she looks up into his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: POPPY
dialogues.text: Plastic means forever, doesn't it? His smile is like a razor-cut, lips slowly widening.

dialogues.speaker: ARGON
dialogues.text: That it does, my dear. That it does. She smiles until he pulls away and begins wheeling out.

dialogues.speaker: POPPY
dialogues.text: Icarus?

dialogues.speaker: ARGON
dialogues.text: I promise, my dear, I will give the matter some consideration.

dialogues.speaker: POPPY
dialogues.text: Consideration?

dialogues.speaker: ARGON
dialogues.text: If you honestly trust me, then you'll have to trust me. He closes the door. Angry, she turns away looking for something to hit. She picks up a hairbrush instead and begins violently brushin her hair in the vanity mirror. Behind her, in the mirror, we see the ottoman scurry mouse-like to the closest door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Brien stands up in agony, holding his back where her heels dug in. A CLATTERING noise draws him to the door. He peeks out just as she pulls down the zipper on her dress. Shrugging out of the sleeves, she walks toward the bathroom. O'Brien searches the room; where the bedroom was red, the bathroom is completely white.  There is nowhere to hide except -- The toilet. He climbs in as the door opens. She drops her dress and kicks off her shoes. As she moves to the tub, O'Brien's hand reaches up and pulls the flush. She hears the TOILET FLUSH, looks at it, wiggles the handle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Susan is moving around the room, thinking. In her gloved hands is the glass beaker which she is wringing nervously, wadding, crinkling, and pulling at it so intensely it sounds like popping bubble wrap. She looks at the windows and at the black steel bars outside. We RISE ABOVE her, MOVING TOWARD the chandelier, TOWARD the single light bulb that is apparently burned out. Until we can SEE INTO the grayish glass and FIND the tip of the fiber optic cable.

dialogues.speaker: MONITOR
dialogues.text: as if looking through a window down into Susan's room.

dialogues.speaker: SIM, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Ubi... Ubiqu... Ubiqu...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sim is reading from a dictionary.

dialogues.speaker: SIM
dialogues.text: Ubiquitous. Present, or seeming to be present, everywhere at the same time; omnipresent. He looks up.

dialogues.speaker: SIM
dialogues.text: I like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Brien zips through the intersecting, elbowing maze of pipes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another toilet seat peeks open. The room is empty. O'Brien climbs out. He grabs a towel, drying himself as he quietly cracks ope the door. When he sees Susan at the desk he can't believe his luck.

dialogues.speaker: O'BRIEN
dialogues.text: Susan! She nearly jumps out of her skin.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: Daniel! They rush to each other's arms.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: I don't believe it. You're here! Oh thank God.

dialogues.speaker: O'BRIEN
dialogues.text: You didn't think I could just leave you?

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: I didn't know what was going to happen. I was just so worried something was going to happen to you.

dialogues.speaker: O'BRIEN
dialogues.text: What could happen? I'm the plastic man, remember? She remembers Argon.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: Oh no! Argon! We have to stop him before he uses the nanobot! We have to get the nanobot!

dialogues.speaker: O'BRIEN
dialogues.text: Where is it?

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: Argon's private lab.

dialogues.speaker: O'BRIEN
dialogues.text: Let's go. They start for the door when Susan whispers.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: Wait. There's a guard.  O'Brien almost laughs.

dialogues.speaker: O'BRIEN
dialogues.text: He'll never know what hit him. He grabs the handle and throws open the door. Susan can't see what he sees, but she knows by his reaction, it's not good.

dialogues.speaker: SIM
dialogues.text: Savior-faire is everywhere. O'Brien backs up into the room, pushed by a very large gun.

dialogues.speaker: SIM
dialogues.text: I am Mr. Ubiquitous, ain't I O'Brien? Doby enters behind Sim with several heavily-armed guards.

dialogues.speaker: SIM
dialogues.text: You know what ubiquitous means, don't you? It means here we go again. Sim laughs very loudly as Argon wheels in, Poppy at his side.

dialogues.speaker: ARGON
dialogues.text: Welcome to my home, Mr. O'Brien. As you can see we've been expecting you. Sim laughs again.

dialogues.speaker: O'BRIEN
dialogues.text: This is wonderfully accommodating of you all. Now I won't have to come looking for you.

dialogues.speaker: SIM
dialogues.text: You were looking for us?

dialogues.speaker: O'BRIEN
dialogues.text: Yeah, I have something I've been meaning to give you.

dialogues.speaker: SIM
dialogues.text: Yeah, and what might that be?

dialogues.speaker: O'BRIEN
dialogues.text: An ass-beating. Would you like yours first, Mr. Sim? Sim cocks his gun and now O'Brien smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just try it! Come on! Do something. Move. Anything. Anything! Just twitch, blink, I dare you! I double dare you! O'Brien becomes completely rigid, frozen like a smiling mannequin. Sim doesn't know what to do. He looks around the room when -- O'Brien's tongue lashes out like a frog's, and snatches the gun.

dialogues.speaker: SIM
dialogues.text: That's disgusting. O'Brien levels the gun at Argon and everyone reacts.

dialogues.speaker: O'BRIEN
dialogues.text: I should kill you right now for what you did to me!

dialogues.speaker: ARGON
dialogues.text: Maybe you should, but you can't. Susan screams as Doby grabs her and pins a gun to her head.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: Run, Daniel! Get out of here!

dialogues.speaker: O'BRIEN
dialogues.text: I'm not leaving without you, Susan!

dialogues.speaker: ARGON
dialogues.text: You don't have to leave, Mr. O'Brien. We've prepared a wonderful room for you. I think you'll find it quite comfortable, so comfortable, in fact, I doubt you'll ever want to leave. As he speaks they all pull out white oxygen masks.

dialogues.speaker: ARGON
dialogues.text: Gardener! The Gardener appears, sprayer in hand and rushes straight at O'Brien, aiming the nozzle into his face. O'Brien tries to back away, to find air but the nozzle is everywhere pumping a mist that envelops both of them. Coughing, choking, unable to breathe, the gas begins to  take effect. O'Brien collapses, the gas-masked figure standing over the soft rubbery head.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: Nooo! Poppy and Argon exchange quiet smiles.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: What are you going to do to him?

dialogues.speaker: ARGON
dialogues.text: Do? Well, I suppose that depends on you. She knows what he wants and her head drops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Gardener adjusts several gas tank valves and we FOLLO the feed lines UP TO the top where the humidifier blower breathes into the sealed cell. The gasses drift down to the bottom where we see the supple red puddle of O'Brien. Floating on the edge of consciousness, O'Brien lifts his head. Outside the curved Plexiglas he sees warped faces staring at him.

dialogues.speaker: O'BRIEN
dialogues.text: «+. Susa... His eyes roll and his head pitches forward, slapping and flattening out against the plexi. Dr. Bright touches the glass.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: What did you use?

dialogues.speaker: ARGON
dialogues.text: A light mixture of oxygen, dioxide, and sodium pentothal. He'll sleep, that's all. She takes a last look at him, then steadies herself as sh turns to Argon.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: I give you the design, you let us both go. That's the deal. Argon nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Makeo and Nebbleman watch as the new assembler tank finishes its test run. The tank looks like a cross between a Giger Sarcophagi an a dry cleaning machine. The motors and pumps suddenly stop as the lab grows quiet

dialogues.speaker: NEBBLEMAN
dialogues.text: ... it's ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Susan is at the desk, her jaw set, her face blank, ina kind of analytical trance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sim and Doby are alone at the control center. Sim is trying to concentrate on Susan with the same intensity that she is concentrating with. He fails.

dialogues.speaker: SIM
dialogues.text: You know why I hate smart women? Doby says nothing.

dialogues.speaker: SIM
dialogues.text: They're always thinking but you never know what they're thinking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly she walks to the far wall and turns out the light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The monitor goes dark.

dialogues.speaker: SIM
dialogues.text: Why'd she do that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the dark, she takes her chair and wedges it under the door handle. She puts on the protective gloves.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: All right, Argon. You want a fight, you got one. Then throws open the freezer unit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a drugged haze, O'Brien searches the edges of his prison. His head and limbs move with a strange fluidity, rising and falling like the molten blebs of a lava lamp. His fingers find the gas line opening in the blower. Taking a deep breath, he sticks his arm into the tiny hol and pulls himself up inside. We FOLLOW the coils of copper tubing DOWN INTO the different tanks of gas. We hear the "TINK, TINK" as he pounds against the metal canisters. Unable to hold his breath, he rises through the gas-feeds back to the opening where he emerges like a giant red droplet of water -- Falling and splashing back into his cell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Poppy is helping Argon undress.

dialogues.speaker: ARGON
dialogues.text: Can you feel it, Poppy? The presence of the moment? Can you feel the weight of its significance?

dialogues.speaker: POPPY
dialogues.text: Oh yes, Icky. I can feel it.

dialogues.speaker: ARGON
dialogues.text: This is what my entire life has been directed at, this moment, this threshold.

dialogues.speaker: POPPY
dialogues.text: Okay, arms up, lean forward. He leans over her shoulder and she holds him up while she takes his pants off.

dialogues.speaker: ARGON
dialogues.text: I stand on the verge of man's greatest triumph over the forces of nature! Pants down, she sets him back into the chair.

dialogues.speaker: ARGON
dialogues.text: Gently, gently. My metamorphosis will be more than a simple transformation. She pulls his feet free of each pant leg.

dialogues.speaker: ARGON
dialogues.text: It will be an ascension.

dialogues.speaker: POPPY
dialogues.text: I'm so excited, Icarus. She stands helping him with his robe.

dialogues.speaker: POPPY
dialogues.text: I was wondering if you'd finished considering?

dialogues.speaker: ARGON
dialogues.text: Considering what?

dialogues.speaker: POPPY
dialogues.text: What I asked you earlier? He realizes what she is talking about.

dialogues.speaker: ARGON
dialogues.text: Poppy, please --

dialogues.speaker: POPPY
dialogues.text: If you loved me like I loved you?

dialogues.speaker: ARGON
dialogues.text: Poppy, this is not the time! There is a KNOCK on the door.

dialogues.speaker: ARGON
dialogues.text: Yes? Dr. Makeo enters.

dialogues.speaker: MAKEO
dialogues.text: We are ready for you, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sim, Doby and several security guards are outside Dr. Bright's room.

dialogues.speaker: SIM
dialogues.text: Dr. Bright. This isn't doing anyone any good. He knocks, yelling at the door.

dialogues.speaker: SIM
dialogues.text: This ain't very cooperative behavior! I'm going to tell Dr. Argon that you ain't cooperating! He shoves at the door but it doesn't budge.

dialogues.speaker: SIM
dialogues.text: Come on! We know you're in there! No answer. He turns to Doby in disgust.

dialogues.speaker: SIM
dialogues.text: Break it down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear DOBY SLAM against the door, but it holds. Across the dark room we see Susan standing at the window.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: Come on, come on... She is holding the glass beaker against the iron bars, infecting them with the replicator fallout. Body batters the door again. She drops the beaker and grabs hold of the two bars. They bend like thick rods of rubber.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: Yes! The next blow vibrates through the entire frame. Ignoring it, she grabs hold of the stool that was also taken from the lab. Stretching out one of the legs, she ties it to one of the non-polymerized bars. The DOOR SPLINTERS at the hinge. Hurrying, she squeezes herself and the stool out between the rubber bars. Standing on the ledge, she makes a crucial mistake: she looks down. The roof of the main laboratory is forty feet away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chatting with the other reporters, Spencer looks up and sees Dr. Bright standing outside the window.

dialogues.speaker: SPENCER
dialogues.text: Holy shit! Jumper! He grabs his cameraman.

dialogues.speaker: SPENCER
dialogues.text: Get this! Get this!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The DOOR SHRIEKS, cracking open. Out on the edge, Susan closes her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: It'll work. It's got to. It's got to. Holding tightly to one of the other legs of the stool, sh takes a deep breathe and -- Steps off the ledge. She falls, the stool stretching surreally, but it is not pliable enough to reach the roof below. Halfway down it slows, about to bungee-bouce her back up. Her body jerks as the leg wrenches from her grip -- Sending her cartwheeling into the open air. She seems to hang for a moment, watching the stool shrinking back to the window. She screams.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Every camera is locked on her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is nothing between her and the roof except the forc of gravity. It sucks her down. Plummeting, helplessly hurtling, she screams again as -- She slams onto the roof, but instead of being splattered against it -- She bounces up. The polymerized roof gives like a trampoline, tossing her lightly until she lays on her back, staring up at the window, adrenaline bubbling out of her in laughter and tears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cameraman looks at Spencer.

dialogues.speaker: SPENCER
dialogues.text: There's a logical explanation. Has to be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sim finds the stool still tied to the bars. Outside he sees Susan climbing down through a roof access door into the quarantined lab.

dialogues.speaker: SIM
dialogues.text: Oh shit. Where's Argon?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Argon sits in his wheelchair, eyes blazing as Nebbleman draws the nanobiotic fluid into a hypodermic needle.

dialogues.speaker: NEBBLEMAN
dialogues.text: Of course you understand, Dr. Argon, that once the nanobot is inside of you, there is no going back --

dialogues.speaker: ARGON
dialogues.text: Shut up and do it! Nebbleman forces down a swallow, and sticks the needle into his neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Susan moves through the unreal reality of the polymerized building. Her feet sink with every step into the floor. Door handles bend like kneaded dough. The concrete formed steps in the stairwell pillow out under her weight and she loses her balance -- Groping for the rail that also distends.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: This is insane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Argon sheds his robe and, wearing black bikini briefs, he starts to climb into the tank. Makeo tries to help him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! I'll do it myself! His legs, withered and atrophied like sticks of beef jerky, drag behind him. With obvious effort, he pulls himself into the chamber. Wheezing, he can only nod to Dr. Makeo, who closes and seals the chamber. Dr. Makeo cranks the pressurized balloon valves, watching the gauges as the chemicals begin to flow from the mixing vats into the main chamber. There is a MUFFLED SCREAM as the chamber begins to fill, KNOCKING and shaking slightly. Several nervous glances are exchanged as the gauges begin to climb.

dialogues.speaker: RED TEETH
dialogues.text: of a strange serrated shaft. O'Brien has formed his arm into a massive tire jack which spans the walls of his transparent cage. His other arm works the lever with slow determination, ratcheting up the shaft. Outside the tank, the polyethylene window begins to bulge where his hand presses. O'Brien glares beneath his heavy eyelids.

dialogues.speaker: O'BRIEN
dialogues.text: Come on, O'Brien --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Susan sneaks out of the stairwell. Down the hall, she sees two members of the containment crew in their heavy protective suits. Each has a tank strapped to their back, and is hosing the entire hall with liquid nitrogen. They do not notice her, as she heads the other way, tryin not to let the floor squeak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Above O'Brien, the HUMIDIFIER HISSES, sodium pentothal wafting down. He grits his rubbery teeth and cranks the lever. It CLICKS one more tooth. The WALLS swell, warping, CREAKING as the lever arcs bac

dialogues.speaker: O'BRIEN
dialogues.text: Just one more... Sweat pours down his face, but just as the TOOTH CLICKS, the arm shaft bends and -- O'Brien collapses into a watery pile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The TANK RUMBLES as Poppy chews at a perfect nail.

dialogues.speaker: POPPY
dialogues.text: I can't stand it! How much longer? Nebbleman watches his timer for a moment, then counts it down.

dialogues.speaker: NEBBLEMAN
dialogues.text: Five, four, three, two -- Drain it! Makeo throws open the drain valves as Nebbleman monitors his improved waste system.

dialogues.speaker: NEBBLEMAN
dialogues.text: It's working, it's working. Makeo unscrews the tank locks and steps back. STEAM WHEEZES from the opening as a strange figure emerges, covered in a Saran Wrap caul. Hunched over, the figure coughs a gelatinous mass from it lungs as it tears itself free of the layer of polymerized sweat. No longer a debilitated cripple, Argon rises to his feet as everyone sees the massive physique restored to all its former glory.

dialogues.speaker: POPPY
dialogues.text: Oh my God. His arms reach out to the heavens as he lets loose the scream that has been trapped for so long inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SCREAM sends a chill through the reporters.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: Oh no. The CREW members hear the SCREAM and stop working. One o them notices her.

dialogues.speaker: CREW
dialogues.text: Hey! Hold it! Stop! They rush at her. Searching for any kind of weapon, Susan grabs a fire extinguisher from the wall. Swinging it like a club, she lets the first one have it but -- It, too, has been polymerized and the red tank bounces of his skull.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: Nuts.

dialogues.speaker: CREW
dialogues.text: Lady, you're in serious trouble! He throws her back against the wall, which she springs of of, kicking him in the balls -- Finally finding something solid. Screaming, he falls to his knees, his hose spewing liquid nitrogen. The second man grabs her, causing her to drop the extinguisher into the puddle of foaming nitrogen. They wrestle until she tears herself free, snatching hold of the extinguisher. She whips around -- Clubbing him again, but this time the frozen TANK EXPLODE over his head, frothing like a shattered beer bottle. He falls to the soft mat-like floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sim and Doby emerge from the elevator and head for the lab. He hears POPPY GIGGLING and Argon's new BOOMING VOICE.

dialogues.speaker: ARGON, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: It's fantastic to be plastic! Sim pushes into the lab and sees Argon, still wearing bikini briefs, bouncing Poppy into the air with his huge rubberized arms.

dialogues.speaker: SIM
dialogues.text: Holy... Argon hears him.

dialogues.speaker: ARGON
dialogues.text: Exactly right, Mr. Sim. You have entered one of the holiest places on Earth. He catches Poppy and she cuddles against his chest.

dialogues.speaker: ARGON
dialogues.text: This lab shall forever be consecrated ground and you, Mr. Sim, stand here a witness to man's ultimate triumph: the polymerization of human flesh! Nebbleman is behind him, using a razor to cut his hair like Susan did to Daniel. Argon laughs.

dialogues.speaker: NEBBLEMAN
dialogues.text: Sir, please try to hold still.

dialogues.speaker: SIM
dialogues.text: So, I guess it worked.

dialogues.speaker: ARGON
dialogues.text: ‘Worked'? 'Worked'?!

dialogues.speaker: ARGON
dialogues.text: A watch works, Mr. Sim. A bureaucrat works. What transpired here cannot be measured by the word "work." His chest swells, as if he were posing down for Mr. Universe.

dialogues.speaker: ARGON
dialogues.text: What you see before you is the culmination of evolution. The realization of the one driving desire at the heart of all great human endeavors; the desire for immortality! The polymerization of human flesh is no mere molecular transmutation, no simple scientific procedure; it is nothing short of a miracle! A miracle that marks the ascension of man from the finite to the infinite! From the transient to the everlasting! His perfect white teeth high-beam the room. Poppy stares,  adulation oozing from every pore.

dialogues.speaker: POPPY
dialogues.text: Oh, Icky... Argon kisses her, hard.

dialogues.speaker: SIM
dialogues.text: Look, I don't mean to rain on everyone's ascension here, but we got a little problem.

dialogues.speaker: ARGON
dialogues.text: Speak.

dialogues.speaker: SIM
dialogues.text: Dr. Bright has escaped. Argon breathes deep, controlling his temper.

dialogues.speaker: ARGON
dialogues.text: If you let her reach those reporters outside the main gate, Mr. Sim -- His hand whip-wraps around Sim's throat.

dialogues.speaker: SIM
dialogues.text: ++. gurk... understood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wearing one of the protective suits, Susan pushes through part of a containment crew, heading for the elevator. Most of the CREW is surrounding the CAPTAIN.

dialogues.speaker: CREW
dialogues.text: The whole west wing is gone, Captain.

dialogues.speaker: CREW
dialogues.text: It's in the phone lines --

dialogues.speaker: CREW
dialogues.text: It's spreading to the underground pipes --

dialogues.speaker: CREW
dialogues.text: We gotta get out of here! The Captain notices Susan.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN
dialogues.text: Hey! Where are you going? Thinking fast, she points to her crotch as though needing to go to the bathroom. The Captain nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Brien is deflated, head cradled in an arm coil. His other arm is raised against the perspex wall. He has turned his finger into a glass cutter, moving it around and around in a slow deliberate circle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Argon stands before the mirror wearing a new black suit, like O'Brien's.

dialogues.speaker: ARGON
dialogues.text: Excellent work, Dr. Nebbleman. You have outdone yourself.

dialogues.speaker: NEBBLEMAN
dialogues.text: Thank you, sir. Poppy steps behind him, running her hands over his body. Someone KNOCKS Sim does.

dialogues.speaker: POPPY
dialogues.text: Oh, Icky, you know what latex does to me... at the door.

dialogues.speaker: ARGON
dialogues.text: Enter.

dialogues.speaker: SIM
dialogues.text: Dr. Argon, everything's starting to come apart here. You hired me to take care of these matters of security and I am trying, but elements are making my job impossible.

dialogues.speaker: ARGON
dialogues.text: Have you found Dr. Bright?

dialogues.speaker: SIM
dialogues.text: No. The captain of the containment crew is closing down the main lab. He says the area has got to be evacuated.

dialogues.speaker: NEBBLEMAN
dialogues.text: He's probably right, sir, the building is probably going to collapse under its own weight.

dialogues.speaker: SIM
dialogues.text: And if we evacuate, what do you want to do with O'Brien?

dialogues.speaker: ARGON
dialogues.text: It'll be better for us if he simply disappears. The gardener will know what to do.

dialogues.speaker: NEBBLEMAN
dialogues.text: Wait, wait, can I at least have his body?

dialogues.speaker: ARGON
dialogues.text: Donated to science. Perfect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The glass cutter tracing the circle has completely lost its shape; his FINGER SQUEAKING against the Plexiglas. The Gardener leads Sim, Doby, and Nebbleman towards O'Brien's geranium.

dialogues.speaker: SIM
dialogues.text: Can I ask you something? Do you ever take that mask off? The Gardener shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: SIM
dialogues.text: Doesn't it get hot? The Gardener nods. At the end of the path, they reach O'Brien's tank. O'Brien sleepily lifts his head.

dialogues.speaker: SIM
dialogues.text: Sorry, pal. Check out time. Moral of story; next life, mind your own business. The Gardener begins to shut off the valves. The gauges drop to zero as the gas OPENING at the top of the tank RASPS and goes SILENT. Immediately, O'Brien knows that he is going to suffocate. He screams and pounds on the Plexi. They all watch as his soft rubbery fists mash uselessly against the walls of the tank.

dialogues.speaker: SIM
dialogues.text: Even a plastic man's gotta breathe, eh, Doc?  Nebbleman is too entranced to reply. At the far end of the conservatory, the door swings open. Sim glances over his shoulder and sees a member of the containment Crew striding toward them.

dialogues.speaker: SIM
dialogues.text: What are you doing here? You're supposed to be looking for the woman.

dialogues.speaker: CREWMAN
dialogues.text: We found her. The voice is muffled by the headgear.

dialogues.speaker: SIM
dialogues.text: What? Did you say you found her? Body catches the scent of something fishy. He turns to the Crew Member. Behind Sim, O'Brien sucks at the thinning air, his punche growing weaker. The Crew Member lunges at Sim but Doby is ready -- Seizing hold of the small body while tearing off the helmet, revealing Susan Bright.

dialogues.speaker: NEBBLEMAN
dialogues.text: Susan!

dialogues.speaker: SIM
dialogues.text: Wellie well, Dr. Bright. You're just in time. O'Brien's eyes bulge when he sees her, but he knows it is too late. His hands press against the plexi, his eyes melt into silicon tears.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: Nooo! Like a wild animal she bites Doby, twisting free just lon enough to jump at Sim and -- Snatch the gun from his belt. Sim grabs her wrist and they fight for control until Susa manages to squeezes off a SINGLE SHOT -- That punches a hole in O'Brien's tank. The hole is tiny, but it is all Plastic Man needs.  He dives at it, thinning to a pencil, driving himself through. He emerges from the other side, like a genie freed from his lamp.

dialogues.speaker: SIM
dialogues.text: Uh-oh. Afraid now, Sim twists Susan's arm behind her back and yanks the gun free. Nebbleman cowers behind Doby. The Gardener slips away, hurrying for his spray can. O'Brien faces Sim, his eyes blazing with malice aforethought. Sim hides behind Susan, holding the gun to her, barely able to see over her shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: SIM
dialogues.text: Here we go again, eh, O'Brien? I got the gun, I got the girl. All you got is some rubber underwear! He laughs, feeling a little better. O'Brien points a single finger that creeps slowly at Sim.

dialogues.speaker: O'BRIEN
dialogues.text: I've been thinking about you, Mr. Sim. Sim watches it as the tip shapes into a fish hook.

dialogues.speaker: O'BRIEN
dialogues.text: All the different ways that I could kill you.

dialogues.speaker: SIM
dialogues.text: Oh yeah? He aims the gun at O'Brien.

dialogues.speaker: SIM
dialogues.text: Maybe you're ready to find out if that hide of yours is bulletproof?

dialogues.speaker: O'BRIEN
dialogues.text: The question is, are you? Sim thumbs back the hammer.

dialogues.speaker: O'BRIEN
dialogues.text: Because once you pull the trigger,  if that bullet doesn't kill me, we both know, you're a dead man. Sim's hand shakes.

dialogues.speaker: SIM
dialogues.text: I ain't afraid of no plastic man. BOOM. The bullet sinks into O'Brien's chest, pushing his flesh back with a shrieking stretch, projecting it out behind him impossibly, until -- The bullet stops. O'Brien looks back at Sim whose eyes fill with fear. Susan dives to the ground as the bullet comes rushing bac and -- With a resounding whip crack, hits Sim right in the chest Sim sinks to the ground, dead. Doby howls and rushes O'Brien who turns his fists into sledgehammers. Nebbleman bolts but Susan snatches hold of him.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: Do you know the best thing about having you as an assistant, Nigel? She wrings the lapel of his lab coat.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: Was knowing that if you ever pissed me off, I could always kick your ass. She winds up just as Nebbleman's eyes cross.

dialogues.speaker: NEBBLEMAN
dialogues.text: Ohhh... He faints into a bruise colored bush. She shakes her head. O'Brien pounds the sound of chirping birds into Doby's skull as Susan sees the Gardener rushing behind him.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: Daniel! But the spray can is already HISSING, pumping out deadly clouds of red gas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not this time, pal! O'Brien clasps his hands together and forms a giant bellows that sucks up all the gas.

dialogues.speaker: O'BRIEN
dialogues.text: Let's see how you like it. He shoves the nozzle of the bellows into the filter of hi gas mask and squeezes. The dark glass eyes fill with smoke as the Gardener thrashes around trying to get the mask off. He stumbles, flailing wildly and smashes into the seamonkey geranium. The little creatures swarm all over him as he collapses t the ground. O'Brien turns just as Susan rushes into his arms.

dialogues.speaker: O'BRIEN
dialogues.text: You saved my life.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: Did you think I could just leave you...? They hold each other tightly, feeling the volatile electrons charging the air, creating an intermolecular bond between them.

dialogues.speaker: O'BRIEN
dialogues.text: Susie... I...

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: You don't have to say anything, Daniel. I'ma scientist. I know what's happening. I recognize the classic symptoms. Dizziness, shortness of breath, sweating palms... I can feel my adrenals secreting, my parasympathetic nervous system quivering, the estradiol coursing through my entire body... Her lips move closer to his.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: And I know there's only one way to cure it... She kisses him and almost melts the polymerized lips righ  off his face. The kiss is so intense, it shakes the entire building around them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The metal frame supporting the tower has finally been affected by the replicators. Two of the legs squash out causing the other legs to bend

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They break the kiss, realizing that the building is actually shaking.

dialogues.speaker: O'BRIEN
dialogues.text: What in the...?

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: Oh shit, the meltdown. It's spread to the tower.

dialogues.speaker: O'BRIEN
dialogues.text: We've got to get the nanobot.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: It's too late. Argon injected it.

dialogues.speaker: O'BRIEN
dialogues.text: You mean he's polymerized, like me? She nods.

dialogues.speaker: O'BRIEN
dialogues.text: That means the nanobot is still inside him.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: O'BRIEN
dialogues.text: What would happen if I threw him into the core?

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: The same thing I suppose. That's all O'Brien needs to hear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is happening beneath the red rubber sheets of Poppy' bed is beyond anything ever pictured in the Kama Sutra. Poppy screams as the earth moves again.  Argon sticks his head out.

dialogues.speaker: ARGON
dialogues.text: Did you feel that?

dialogues.speaker: POPPY
dialogues.text: Did I? I've been waiting for that for years.

dialogues.speaker: ARGON
dialogues.text: Not that. The building shivers and leans again.

dialogues.speaker: ARGON
dialogues.text: That. It's the fall-out. We have to get out of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The tower leans a few more degrees as outside the lab, bedlam erupts. The containment crew and security force scatter from the building like rats pouring from a sinking ship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spencer grabs hold of the fence, watching the tower lean.

dialogues.speaker: SPENCER
dialogues.text: We gotta get in there! He notices that the fence is warm.

dialogues.speaker: SPENCER
dialogues.text: Hey, what's up with the fence? He pulls back and it stretches like gum.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Brien and Susan are arguing in the office. The floor weirdly tilts under them.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: Daniel, just forget Argon. Let's get out of here. We'll find another way to stop the waste.

dialogues.speaker: O'BRIEN
dialogues.text: We don't have time to argue, Susan. He's dragging her toward the door to the roof.

dialogues.speaker: O'BRIEN
dialogues.text: I'm going to set you down outside. You have to get over to the reporters outside the gate. We have to warn people what's happening. She doesn't like being dragged anywhere. That hurts.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: You're not going after Argon!

dialogues.speaker: O'BRIEN
dialogues.text: I have to!

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: Do the words 'hero fantasies' mean anything to you? How about ‘infantile dementia'?

dialogues.speaker: O'BRIEN
dialogues.text: Maybe you're right but so what. I'm going to beat the snot out of him,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She is about to continue the fight when the elevator open and ends it. Argon and Poppy get out. The men begin circling each other.

dialogues.speaker: ARGON
dialogues.text: How apropos.

dialogues.speaker: O'BRIEN
dialogues.text: Ain't it.

dialogues.speaker: ARGON
dialogues.text: As you can see I am a new man, just like you.

dialogues.speaker: O'BRIEN
dialogues.text: Oh no. You're not like me. In fact, I'm betting you're the same greedy, remorseless, egomaniacal bad guy you always were. O'Brien pumps up a huge fist. His forearm then goes slack as he begins swinging the fist like a medieval morning star.

dialogues.speaker: ARGON
dialogues.text: It remains to be seen who is the good guy and who is the bad guy. History is written by the victor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The only history I'm gonna write is your obituary! He lunges, the fist arcing down as Argon awkwardly counters -- The blow connects snapping Argon's head back.

dialogues.speaker: POPPY
dialogues.text: Icky!

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: Get him, Daniel! Knock his block off! Poppy hisses at Susan as the two women now edge toward on another. O'Brien presses his attack, battering and bludgeoning Argon -- Every blow landing with a loud rubber smack that reverberates through Argon's teeth. Desperate, the villain flails back, long ropy limbs tryin to tie O'Brien up as -- His extending legs drive both men flying backwards -- Crashing through the enormous vista-windows.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: Daniel!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The reporters are lifting the fence and scrambling inside Spencer hears the WINDOW EXPLODE and sees the black and red intertwined bodies -- Still locked in combat, pummeling, kicking, biting -- Cometing straight to the earth. Ka-boing. The force of the fall blasts them apart each rebounding into the air -- O'Brien flipping, righting himself as he lands on his feet. Argon quickly recovers. Spencer does not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That-that's not possible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two women smell blood.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: Okay, Barbie, let's get this over with.

dialogues.speaker: POPPY
dialogues.text: Don't worry, four eyes. From her bag, Poppy whips out a razor knife.

dialogues.speaker: POPPY
dialogues.text: It's not going to take long.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Brien and Argon have at one another again. Spencer stands in the white wash of his cameraman's light

dialogues.speaker: SPENCER
dialogues.text: We are just outside Argon Labs and I can, without fear of hyperbole, say that what is happening behind me is the most unbelievably fantastic thing the world has ever seen. Argon is learning quickly, morphing his body the way O'Brien does.

dialogues.speaker: SPENCER
dialogues.text: Two men, if they are indeed really men, locked in mortal combat. Pure Jack-the-King-Kirby pugilistics.

dialogues.speaker: SPENCER
dialogues.text: One of them apparently the dangerous radical environmentalist authorities have been searching for. The other appears to be Icarus Argon, or at least Icarus Argon fifteen years ago. Fists flying, blasted bodies hurling through the air only to bounce right back.

dialogues.speaker: SPENCER
dialogues.text: There are times, singular fleeting moments when a man glimpses an event which he knows is going to change  the world. Although I do not fully understand what is happening here, I sense that this fight is somehow about the future of the planet. Argon suddenly realizes that O'Brien is leading the battl closer and closer to the main lab.

dialogues.speaker: ARGON
dialogues.text: I know what you're doing.

dialogues.speaker: O'BRIEN
dialogues.text: You mean besides kicking your ass?!

dialogues.speaker: ARGON
dialogues.text: You think you can use me to stop the meltdown. O'Brien's face reveals nothing.

dialogues.speaker: ARGON
dialogues.text: It's not going to happen. His arms shoot up to the helicopter pad, but O'Brien snag hold of him.

dialogues.speaker: O'BRIEN
dialogues.text: Not so fast, Icky, I promised you an ass-beating and I'm just getting started. Boom. Fist-imprinted in the middle of Argon's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Poppy slashes viciously at Susan, driving her back into a corner where -- She ducks behind the statue of Icarus and shoves -- Tipping it over onto Poppy, who screams falling back as the statue smashes to the ground. Susan grabs one of the broken arms and backhands Poppy before she gets to her feet. Susan is about to finish her off when the building tilts again throwing her, crashing over the desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The TOWER SQUEAKS again, legs bending, giving way, throwing the crowd into a panic. If O'Brien even notices we can't tell. His attack is an unrelenting fury --  Fists like jackhammers -- Like wrecking balls and ballistic missiles. Bomb after bomb rearranges Argon's face. His body growing soft and supple, his knees turning to syrup as -- O'Brien winds up the haymaker.

dialogues.speaker: O'BRIEN
dialogues.text: Well, Argon, according to you this makes me the good guy, don't it? Ka-boom. Lights out. Argon hits the ground with a wet smack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Poppy is up first, delivering a stiletto-heeled kick to Susan's face, knocking her out. The building trembles again and Poppy forgets Susan and hurries to the roof door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crowd has burst apart, running from the building, while O'Brien shoulders Argon and heads for the main lab floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Poppy pushes outside to the roof. The helicopter has shifted toward the tilted edge. She climbs into the pilot's seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Brien climbs the polymerized stairs in giant steps. He is heading for Susan's lab when -- Argon's eyes snap open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Susan wakes up as the BUILDING continues to GROAN. She goes to the elevator but it no longer works. She then sees the open roof door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Argon attacks with snake-like speed, whip-wrapping both arms like twin boa constrictors around O'Brien's neck.  A small "gak" spits out as O'Brien feels his windpipe pinch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The helicopter BLADES begin to CHOP as Susan flings open the roof door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Brien throws himself backward against the wall, trying to smash Argon off him, but -- Everything is polymerized. They bounce and roll into a smaller lab, Argon wrapped around O'Brien like a creeping-ivy vine. O'Brien thrashes through the room, slamming into stainles steel scientific equipment -- Only to bounce off them like they were nerf toys. Desperate, he hurls them both at a large window but -- The polymerized glass balloons out, both bodies visible inside the bulging bubble that -- Snaps back, slinging them across the lab and out into the hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Susan tries to climb into the helicopter when the tower tilts more violently than ever. The helicopter slides out hooking its landing gear on the guard rail, flipping up out of control, killing the engine. Thrown free, Susan slides toward the same edge where the helicopter dangles precariously. Below them is the roof of the main lab.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Brien falls to his knees. He is ready to give up when he sees something. His face as red as his suit, his breath a tiny rasp, he begins to crawl.

dialogues.speaker: ARGON
dialogues.text: Die! Die! Damn you! Why don't you just die!  The world spins and goes spotty as he collapses.

dialogues.speaker: ARGON
dialogues.text: Yes! But his hands keep going, cartoon fingers groping down th hall toward -- The tank of liquid nitrogen still laying near the broken fire extinguisher. The hands take hold of it --

dialogues.speaker: ARGON
dialogues.text: No! Oh no! And come rushing back like the cavalry. Argon screams as the nitrogen sprays out, soaking his arms, freezing them solid. A little frosted, O'Brien slips his head free while Argon tries to crack apart his arms. He looks up and sees O'Brien aiming the nitrogen again.

dialogues.speaker: ARGON
dialogues.text: No. O'Brien! Don't! Please! O'Brien lets him have it, full frosting blast. He grabs hold of him and with two huge steps bursts into Susan's lab.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room pulses with a seething sense of sickness as everything turns to gray slime like a rotting banana turning brown. Fluorescent lights drip like stalactites from the droopin drop-ceiling. Equipment hangs like swamp-moss, or sits in puddles like melting chocolate. The center of the room is a crater, the floor sagging limply like a wet napkin. At the bottom of the crater where the assembler tank used to be is a pond of pale glowing goo. Argon cracks his jaw loose. They stand at the edge of the crater.

dialogues.speaker: ARGON
dialogues.text: Please, O'Brien, don't do this to  me! I'll give you anything you want!

dialogues.speaker: O'BRIEN
dialogues.text: Yeah, I'm going to finish what you started -- O'Brien sees the finger slither out like a black tentacle around his leg. O'Brien slips free and -- Hurls Argon out over the crater. Argon screams as his finger reaches for the soft pipes above the drop-ceiling. The finger finds a hold just before Argon hits the white pool. He bounces, dangling above it.

dialogues.speaker: ARGON
dialogues.text: You can't do this! You owe me, O'Brien. I made you plastic! I made you!

dialogues.speaker: O'BRIEN
dialogues.text: That's right. And making me was the biggest mistake you ever made! O'Brien's hand sears at us shaping into a huge pair of scissors. Argon screams as the scissors clip through the finger strand -- Dropping Argon into the pond of moon-milk. Almost immediately there is an reaction. The pool sizzles and begins to swell into a single volcanic bubble. O'Brien whirls and runs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Susan carefully slides to the edge, reaching out to help Poppy.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: Grab my hand!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The building is shaking as Nebbleman wakes up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bubble continues to swell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Brien races through the rubbery hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Poppy is struggling to get out of the safety harness when --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bubble bursts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The force of the blast launches O'Brien into the air and he recoils tucking himself into a ball -- Super-bouncing down the hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The building shivers from the explosion and the helicopte pitches back. Swinging out from Susan who loses her balance and slips.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The chain reaction spreads out from the crater as molecules shift, rebounding, changing into an ionic solid -- Like blown glass that is cooled too quickly -- Shivering with the sound of CRACKING ICE FLOES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The tower tips again, ready to fall at any moment. Susan clings to the rail while inside the helicopter Popp is no longer struggling. She is staring up at the enormous full moon above her.

dialogues.speaker: POPPY
dialogues.text: Icky...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Brien dives from the lab as part of it collapses with a shower of CRASHING GLASS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rail gives out and the helicopter falls.  It seems for a moment to drift like a snowflake as Poppy reaches at the moon.

dialogues.speaker: POPPY
dialogues.text: Plastic means forever... It hits the roof and shatters through it as though it wer sheet candy. Susan is thrown out over the edge dangling from the rail as -- The helicopter shatters through the building with an ear- bleeding CRASH before its metal carcass bursts into flames. As Susan clings to the rail, she looks up and sees Nebbleman. He stares at her through his broken glasses.

dialogues.speaker: NEBBLEMAN
dialogues.text: This is all your fault, Susan... He bends toward her clutching fingers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Brien is searching everywhere for Susan.

dialogues.speaker: O'BRIEN
dialogues.text: Susan! Susan!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nebbleman is peeling up her fingers, when -- The tower begins to fall. With a final METAL SHRIEK the legs give out completely. Still holding on, Susan falls with the tower. Nebbleman's eyes bulge as he is thrown over the rail and into the fiery abyss... O'Brien looks up as the tower arcs down and sees Susan clinging, dangling, about to be buried beneath it.

dialogues.speaker: O'BRIEN
dialogues.text: Noooo! A red rubber rocket sears across the night sky. Susan's grip fails and she drops into -- O'Brien, who has flattened himself out like a giant luge chute.  She slides away as the tower collapses into the fiery oblivion, falling lightly into the soft waiting arms of..

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: My hero... They kiss. We RISE ABOVE them, REACHING UP FOR the moon in all its luminous glory, WATCHING as it morphs into a blazing sun. We PAN DOWN TO a new day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Brien is carrying a brown bag filled with groceries. Susan is walking beside him. She suddenly starts laughing.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: God, when we were in that store all I could think about was that one time, when we were in school, and you attacked that little kid who wanted some cereal. Do you remember that?

dialogues.speaker: O'BRIEN
dialogues.text: I remember I was trying to help...

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: God, what a fight that was.

dialogues.speaker: O'BRIEN
dialogues.text: We were different people then.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: Do you suppose that was our problem? We met before our time? I think that happens a lot. People, events, planets all just circling each other waiting for that moment when everything clicks into place. O'Brien is no longer listening to her, staring at something like an attack dog.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: That moment of synchronicity where everything seems to work out just the way it should. Walking straight toward them is the Litterbug.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: I suppose if there were a god, it  would be those moments that would make me believe in her... or him. Just like he did before, the Litterbug gulps from a styrofoam cup.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: Daniel, what is... She sees what he is staring at just as the Litterbug crumbles the cup and pitches it into the bushes.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: Oh no. The Litterbug continues toward them.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: Daniel, please, don't, not today, it's such a nice day... She watches him bracing for the attack, jaw working, hackles raising, fists clenching.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: Aww shit. The Litterbug reaches them, shoves his way past and O'Brien -- Lets him go. He smiles.

dialogues.speaker: O'BRIEN
dialogues.text: You're right. It is a nice day. He walks over and picks up the cup himself.

dialogues.speaker: O'BRIEN
dialogues.text: I can throw it out. No big deal. She can't believe it. His arm shoots out and a moment later whaps back; the cup is gone. She smiles and he wraps his arm around her.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: Things do change.

dialogues.speaker: O'BRIEN
dialogues.text: I guess they do. They stroll on and we GLIDE BACK in the direction his arm shot -- Where we see the Litterbug wedged head first into a wire meshed trash can, kicking like an inverted cockroach, the styrofoam cup stuffed in his mouth.  And we CLOSE ON the sign -- "Keep litter in its place." FADE OUT.
